channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For the Analyst: Peer Benchmarking Methods to Improve Earnings Forecasts
item.description: Peer benchmarking is a vexing task for financial analysts but one that is critical for forecasting earnings. This straightforward measure can help find peers for relative performance, compensation, and valuation benchmarking.

item.title: Renault boss lament's Volkswagen's inability to 'work as a team' as joint cheap EV plan collapses
item.description: Renault CEO Luca de Meo had been trying to collaborate on an affordable version of the Twingo.

item.title: Building LLMs in the Open-Source Community: A Call to Action for Investment Professionals
item.description: Large language models like ChatGPT are changing the way we think about investing and reshaping roles in the investment profession.

item.title: Biden’s tariffs on Chinese EVs make sense—but only for a while
item.description: The Biden administration aims to create a defensible moat so that U.S. automakers’ efforts to build competitive EVs are not wiped out by Chinese imports.

item.title: Sustainability Reporting: Navigating Assurance Practices
item.description: Don't be lulled into a false sense of security by the word "assurance" when evaluating sustainability reports. Assurance practices vary, and investors would be wise to learn more about the different levels of coverage.

item.title: How do I choose the right cofounder for my startup?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about finding the right cofounder and the trade-off between startup life and family stability.

item.title: The Power of Clicks, Likes, and Shares: Promote the Right Kind of Financial Content
item.description: Not all financial content creators on social media are created equal. A broad differentiation can be made between influencers, knowledge sharers, and aspiring thought leaders.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says there's a chance the Fed could further hike rates instead of cutting
item.description: "Do I think that rates can go up a little bit? Yes I do. And if they do is the world prepared for it? Not really."

item.title: Why the New T+1 Settlement Cycle Matters: A Global Index Provider’s Perspective
item.description: Shorter settlement periods are meant to protect market participants. But the new T+1 settlement cycle for US equities may have undesirable knock-on effects for financial market participants around the world, including index fund managers.

item.title: France lost control of parts of New Caledonia
item.description: The Pacific territory of 270,000 people has been in turmoil since May 13, when violence erupted over plans to extend voting rights to more residents, which indigenous Kanaks say would diminish their electoral influence.
